title: Unit 3 Sec 4: Digestive System
description: Assessment of GI anatomy, disorders, and nursing management including stoma care.

questions.question: Which characteristic pain pattern distinguishes a Duodenal Ulcer from a Gastric Ulcer?

options.text: Pain occurs 2-4 hours after meals and at night (Pain-Food-Relief)
Pain is constant and radiates to the shoulder

questions.explanation: Duodenal ulcers cause pain when the stomach is empty (night pain) and are relieved by eating. Gastric ulcers hurt *when* eating.

questions.question: The accumulation of ammonia in the brain due to liver failure causes a neuropsychiatric syndrome known as ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Hepatic encephalopathy occurs when the liver cannot detoxify ammonia.

questions.question: Select the correct nursing interventions for a patient with a new Colostomy. (Select all that apply)

options.text: Restrict fluids to prevent loose stools
Provide skin care to peristomal area
Observe for stoma prolapse or retraction

questions.explanation: Fluids should generally be encouraged, not restricted, unless there is a specific contraindication. Stoma observation is critical.

questions.question: What is the term for the accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, often caused by portal hypertension?
questions.explanation: Ascites is the pathological accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity.

questions.question: In acute pancreatitis, the autodigestion of the pancreas is primarily caused by which enzyme?
questions.explanation: Trypsin is a proteolytic enzyme; when activated prematurely inside the pancreas, it causes autodigestion.
